sentences.sentence: Only in one corner was it still winter.
It was the farthest corner of the garden, and a little boy was standing there.
He was so small that he could not climb up to( 爬上 ) the branches( 树枝 ) of the tree.
Instead he was walking all around it, crying sadly.
The poor tree was still covered with frost( 霜 ) and snow, and the North Wind was blowing and roaring( 呼啸 ) above it.
“Climb up( 爬上来 ), little boy!” said the Tree.
It lowered its branches( 树枝 ) down as much as it could; but the boy was too tiny.
The Giant( 巨人 )’s heart melted( 融化 ) as he looked out.
“How selfish( 自私的 ) I have been!” he said.
“Now I know why the Spring would not come here.
I will put that poor little boy on the top of the tree, and then I will knock down( 拆除 ) the wall.
Then my garden will be the children’s playground for ever and ever.”
He really felt sorry for what he had done.
So he went downstairs( 下楼 ), quietly opened the front door, and went out into the garden.
But when the children saw him they felt so afraid that they all ran away, and the garden became winter again.
Only the little boy did not run, because his eyes were so full of tears( 眼泪 ) that he did not see the Giant( 巨人 ) coming.
And the Giant( 巨人 ) came up behind him quietly and picked him up gently in his hand, and put him up into the tree.
Suddenly the tree was full of color and life, and the birds came and sang on it.
The little boy reached out his two arms, threw them around the Giant( 巨人 )’s neck, and kissed him.
When the other children saw this, they knew that the Giant( 巨人 ) was not bad any longer.
They came running back, and with them came the Spring.
“It is your garden now, little children,” said the Giant( 巨人 ).
Then he took a large axe( 斧子 ) and knocked down the wall.
When other people walked by, they saw the Giant( 巨人 ) playing with the children, in the most beautiful garden they had ever seen.
All day long they played, and in the evening the children came to say goodbye to the Giant( 巨人 ).
“But where is your little friend?” he said.
“Where is the boy I put into the tree?”
The Giant( 巨人 ) loved him the best, because he had kissed him.
“We don’t know,” answered the children.
“He has gone away.”
“You must tell him I want him to come here tomorrow,” said the Giant( 巨人 ).
But the children said that they did not know where he lived, and had never seen him before.
This made the Giant( 巨人 ) feel very sad.
Every day after school, the children came and played with the Giant( 巨人 ).
But the little boy whom the Giant( 巨人 ) loved was never seen again.
The Giant( 巨人 ) was very kind to all the children, but he missed his first little friend, and often spoke of him.
“How I really would like to see him!” he used to say.
Years passed by( （时间）过去 ), and the Giant( 巨人 ) grew very old and weak.
He could not play with the children any more, and so he sat in a huge soft chair.
He spent his days watching the children play their games, and looking happily at his garden.
“I have many beautiful flowers,” he said, “but the children are the most beautiful flowers of all.”
One winter morning he looked out of his window while he was getting dressed.
He did not hate the Winter anymore.
He knew now that it was just the Spring sleeping.
The flowers were resting, and he would see them again soon.
Suddenly he saw something so wonderful that he could not believe his eyes.
He looked and looked, and rubbed( 揉 ) his eyes and looked again.
In the farthest corner of the garden was a tree covered with lovely white flowers.
Its branches( 树枝 ) were all golden, and silver fruit hung down from them.
Underneath the tree he saw the little boy he had loved.
The Giant( 巨人 ) felt very happy, and ran downstairs( 跑下楼 ), out into the garden as fast as he could.
He hurried across the grass, and came near to the child.
And when he came quite close his face grew red with anger, and he said, “Who has dared( 胆敢 ) to hurt you?”
On the palms( 手掌 ) of the child’s hands were the wounds( 伤口 ) from two nails( 钉子 ), and the wounds( 伤口 ) from two nails( 钉子 ) were on his little feet, too.
“Who has dared( 胆敢 ) to hurt you?” cried the Giant( 巨人 ).
“Tell me, so that I can take my big axe( 斧子 ) and kill him.”
“No!” answered the child.
“These are the wounds( 伤口 ) of Love.”
“Who are you?” said the Giant( 巨人 ), and a strange feeling of awe( 敬畏 ) came over him.
He got down on his knees in front of the little child.
The child smiled at the Giant( 巨人 ), and said to him, “You let me play once in your garden.
So today you will come with me to my garden, which is Paradise( 天堂 ).”
And when the children ran into the garden that afternoon,
they found the Giant( 巨人 ) lying dead under the tree, all covered with white flowers.

question.cn: 巨人在花园的角落里看到什么？
question.en: What did the Giant see at the corner of his garden?

options.cn: 他看到一个小男孩在哭泣。
options.en: He saw a little boy crying.

options.cn: 他看到一个漂亮的小女孩儿站在那儿。
options.en: He saw a beautiful girl standing there.

analysis: 文中提到“It was the farthest corner of the garden, and a little boy was standing there. He was so small that he could not climb up to the branches of the tree. Instead he was walking all around it, crying sadly.”因此本题选A。

question.cn: 看到春回大地之后巨人决定做什么？
question.en: What did the Giant decide to do after seeing the return of spring?

options.en: He decided to close the garden again.

options.cn: 他决定把花园变成孩子们的游乐场。
options.en: He decided to make his own garden a playground for children.

options.cn: 他决定离开花园以便让更多孩子玩耍。
options.en: He decided to leave his garden so that more children could play.

analysis: 文中的巨人自白道“Now I know why the Spring would not come here. I will put that poor little boy on the top of the tree, and then I will knock down the wall. Then my garden will be the children’s playground for ever and ever.” 因此本题选B。

question.cn: 很多年过去了，为什么巨人不能与孩子们玩耍了？
question.en: After years passed by, why couldn't the Giant play with the children?

options.cn: 因为他不再喜欢孩子们了。
options.en: Because he didn't like the children anymore.

options.cn: 因为他只想和小男孩玩。
options.en: Because he only wanted to play with the little boy.
Because he was old and weak.

analysis: 文中提到“Years passed by, and the Giant grew very old and weak. He could not play with the children any more, and so he sat in a huge soft chair.”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 为什么巨人不再讨厌冬天？
question.en: Why didn't the Giant hate the Winter anymore?

options.en: Because the flowers blossomed all the year around.

options.cn: 因为他现在知道那只是春天在睡觉。
options.en: Because he knew now that it was just the Spring sleeping.
Because he liked the Snow and the North Wind.

analysis: 文中提到，"He did not hate the Winter anymore. He knew now that it was just the Spring sleeping."因此答案选B。
